page.title: 15Care for the Elderly in Ash.
page.content: Ash provides sheltered acomodation for 88 elderly people and a day care centre for about 100 people each day. Primrose Court has been open for 26 years and Abbeywood is the newest home opened in 1983. Primrose Court has a bed_sitting room and kitchen for every resident, baths, showers and toilets are shared. In Abbeywood there are individual bedrooms each containing a handwashing basin. Daily meals are made by the kitchen staff for the residents in Abbeywood. Shawfield Day Centre cares for the infirm and disabled as well as the elderly of the village. It provides a midday lunch, a hairdressers and a bathroom for those who need help. The centre has a minibus to take the more infirm members to the centre. The members can play cards and listen to music. It is open weekdays until 4pm.
